title: Putin 'overseeing' situation in Syria, Iran – Former Pentagon official
text: Tens of thousands of refugees have fled from northeastern Syria following the pullout of US forces from the area. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has given Kurdish fighters an ultimatum to leave the region or face consequences. NATO allies have placed an embargo on weapons sales to Turkey. Former US diplomat Jim Jatras and Former Pentagon official Michael Maloof discuss the latest from region . Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam attempted to deliver her annual policy address but she was heckled by protesters. She eventually released a pre-recorded speech. RT America’s Michele Greenstein has the latest on the ground in Hong Kong. Children across the country may be attending schools in buildings that are contaminated with toxic chemicals. An investigation found that Polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) remain in tens of thousands of public schools, even though the chemicals were banned decades ago. RT America’s Trinity Chavez reports.
